intro: Scrophularia wirtgenii, commonly known as the Wirtgen's figwort, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae, which includes many species with medicinal and ornamental value. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with a distinctive two-lipped structure typical of the family. Scrophularia wirtgenii is often found in open woodlands and along rocky slopes, where it thrives in well-drained soil.
